Description:
Detects usage of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal, etc.) via command line

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Obfuscated IP Via CLI
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((process_path like '%\ping.exe' or process_path like '%\arp.exe') and ((command like '% 0x%' or command like '%//0x%' or command like '%.0x%' or command like '%.00x%') or (command like '%http://%%' and command like '%%2e%') or (command re 'https?://[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.0[0-9]{3,4}' and command re 'https?://[0-9]{1,3}\.0[0-9]{3,7}' and command re 'https?://0[0-9]{3,11}' and command re 'https?://(0[0-9]{1,11}\.){3}0[0-9]{1,11}' and command re 'https?://0[0-9]{1,11}' and command re ' [0-7]{7,13}')) and  not command re 'https?://((25[0-5]|(2[0-4]|1\d|[1-9])?\d)(\.|\b)){4}')
